item.title: Couple meeting financial advisor
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.excerpt:encoded: Businessman explaining loan policy to young couple. Happy young couple discussing with a financial agent their new investment. Financial consultant presents bank investments to a young couple.

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1458134705800{padding-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column width="7/12"][tm-heading h2="ONLINE ENQUIRY FORM" h4="Get in touch"][vc_column_text]Feel free to get in touch to book a consultation or if you simply have some questions, our team of specialists are always happy to help.[/vc_column_text][contact-form-7 id="4"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/12"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_empty_space height="55px"][vc_tta_tabs spacing="2" active_section="1" el_class="contacttext"][vc_tta_section title="HEAD OFFICE" tab_id="contacticon" el_class="contactmethods"][tm-servicebox h2="PHONE:" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-bus" i_background_style="none" i_on_border="" i_size="md" h4="01785 711556" el_class="contactmethod"][/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="EMAIL:" txt_align="left" shape="square" add_icon="left" i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-diamond" i_background_style="none" i_on_border="" i_size="md" h4="Enquiries@Dunham-McCarthy.co.uk" el_class="contactmethod"][/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="ADDRESS:" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-food" i_background_style="none" i_on_border="" i_size="md" h4="Dunston Business Village, Penkridge, ST18 9AB" el_class="contactmethod"][/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="WORKING HOURS:" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-clip" i_background_style="none" i_on_border="" i_size="md" h4="Mon to Fri- 8:30am to 7:30pm" el_class="contactmethod"][/tm-servicebox][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SITE MAP" tab_id="1456567113938-ecc6b0d6-06ae"][vc_column_text]

item.title: Services
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row" bgtype="grey" css=".vc_custom_1470818245176{padding-bottom: 70px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="11355" img_size="full"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][tm-heading h2="PROTECTING WHAT MATTERS" h4="Old & young"][vc_column_text]At every stage in a clients life Dunham McCarthy can help. A younger client might be interested in finding a mortgage or taking out insurances. As time passes the same client may wish to leave assets through a will or protect them for future generations. On retirement we could help maximise a clients income, minimise tax or perhaps release equity. Even after the client has passed away we can help deal with the administration of the estate. As life goes on, our team are always here to help.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner el_class="small tm-break-colum-992"][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][tm-servicebox h2="Home Visits Available" item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row css=".vc_custom_1457084889613{padding-bottom: 60px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][tm-heading h2="PROFESSIONAL SERVICES" h4="Specialist" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][tm-servicebox h2="Estate Planning" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-bluetooth" i_on_border="" i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" el_class="tm-connected animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Will writing, trusts drafting, tax planning and much more, we are here to help you protect your families future.[/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="Financial Services" txt_align="left" shape="round" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-edge" i_on_border="" i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" el_class="tm-connected animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Whether borrowing buying your first home or saving for retirement, we have advisors that can help.[/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="Asset Protection" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-usb" i_on_border="" i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Through careful planning our specialists can help ensuring your property passes to future generations.[/tm-servicebox][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="11226" img_size="full" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]From a simple will to a commercial mortgage, The Dunham McCarthy Group companies provide a holistic approach to legal and financial services.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" bgtype="grey" equalheight="true" css=".vc_custom_1464700466204{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}" break_in_responsive_996="true"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1470421871462{background-image: url(http://final.dunham-mccarthy.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Slider-6.jpg?id=11012) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1464504280531{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-right: 60px !important;padding-bottom: 60px !important;padding-left: 60px !important;}"][tm-heading h2="ABOUT US" h4="A few words" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_tta_accordion shape="square" color="white" gap="10" active_section="1" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_tta_section i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-world" title="Our Company" tab_id="1456301258004-f6ac1659-39b1" add_icon="true"][vc_column_text]At Dunham McCarthy we practice a holistic approach to estate planning with specialists providing advice on many legal and financial products and services. Our business has grown to provide for the varied needs of our clients. This growth, we feel, can be attributed to our relentless pursuit of the highest standards of customer service and professional expertise. The future of Dunham McCarthy will centre around developing our services to cater for the ever more complex needs of 10,000+ our existing clients.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-calendar" title="Our Beginnings" tab_id="1456301258052-77a8806b-99b3" add_icon="true"][vc_column_text]Originally established to provide private clients with affordable and convenient professional services, Dunham McCarthy has grown from a small two partner firm, to a group of companies employing many professionals specialising in various financial and legal practice areas. The introduction of a 'Free Will Writing Service' designed to encourage clients to get organised has enabled Dunham McCarthy to grow quickly. With over 10,000 clients, it is this innovative approach coupled with exceptional long term customer service that sets us aside from our competitors.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-study" title="Our Philosophy" tab_id="1456308251137-de6623ac-beae" add_icon="true"][vc_column_text]At Dunham McCarthy we endeavour to foster an enjoyable working environment, based on open communication and mutual respect; we celebrate innovation, teamwork, and loyalty. For our clients we provide innovative solutions, and a dedication to quality customer service.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section i_type="linecons" i_icon_linecons="vc_li vc_li-settings" title="Our Mission" tab_id="1456308495551-78a791b2-7612" add_icon="true"][vc_column_text]Our mission declares our purpose as a practice and serves as the standard against which we weigh our actions and decisions. Simply put it is to reach business goals through uncompromising dedication to client service and ethical standards - to put our clients at the center of our world.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1456558338917{padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="11302" img_size="full" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][tm-heading h2="EMPLOYEE BENEFITS" h4="No cost, no catch, no excuse" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Dunham McCarthy provide a full professional Will drafting service free of charge to employees at many councils, fire services, prison services, universities and selected private sector employers. Would your team be interested in joining thousands of other employees and taking advantage of our ‘Free Will Writing’ benefit?[/vc_column_text][vc_separator][vc_row_inner el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][tm-facts-in-digits title="POSITIVE REVIEWS" add_icon="" after="%"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][tm-facts-in-digits item.title: Privacy
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion shape="square" color="white" gap="10" active_section="1"][vc_tta_section title="What is this Privacy Policy for?" tab_id="1470424561480-14267a5b-c180"][vc_column_text]This privacy policy is for this website www.Dunham-McCarthy.co.uk and served by The Dunham McCarthy Group and governs the privacy of its users who choose to use it. The policy sets out the different areas where user privacy is concerned and outlines the obligations & requirements of the users, the website and website owners. Furthermore the way this website processes, stores and protects user data and information will also be detailed within this policy.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="The website" tab_id="1470424671670-300ded68-0d78"][vc_column_text]This website and its owners take a proactive approach to user privacy and ensure the necessary steps are taken to protect the privacy of its users throughout their visiting experience. This website complies to all UK national laws and requirements for user privacy.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Section 1" tab_id="1470424671247-8f0d8e41-a002"][vc_column_text]Use of Cookies This website uses cookies to better the users experience while visiting the website. Where applicable this website uses a cookie control system allowing the user on their first visit to the website to allow or disallow the use of cookies on their computer / device. This complies with recent legislation requirements for websites to obtain explicit consent from users before leaving behind or reading files such as cookies on a user's computer / device. Cookies are small files saved to the user's computers hard drive that track, save and store information about the user's interactions and usage of the website. This allows the website, through its server to provide the users with a tailored experience within this website. Users are advised that if they wish to deny the use and saving of cookies from this website on to their computers hard drive they should take necessary steps within their web browsers security settings to block all cookies from this website and its external serving vendors. This website uses tracking software to monitor its visitors to better understand how they use it. This software is provided by Google Analytics which uses cookies to track visitor usage. The software will save a cookie to your computers hard drive in order to track and monitor your engagement and usage of the website, but will not store, save or collect personal information. You can read Google's privacy policy here for further information [ http://www.google.com/privacy.html ]. Other cookies may be stored to your computers hard drive by external vendors when this website uses referral programs, sponsored links or adverts. Such cookies are used for conversion and referral tracking and typically expire after 30 days, though some may take longer. No personal information is stored, saved or collected.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Section 1" tab_id="1470424670805-e34bef47-5e7a"][vc_column_text]Contact & Communication Users contacting this website and/or its owners do so at their own discretion and provide any such personal details requested at their own risk. Your personal information is kept private and stored securely until a time it is no longer required or has no use, as detailed in the Data Protection Act 1998. Every effort has been made to ensure a safe and secure form to email submission process but advise users using such form to email processes that they do so at their own risk. This website and its owners use any information submitted to provide you with further information about the products / services they offer or to assist you in answering any questions or queries you may have submitted. This includes using your details to subscribe you to any email newsletter program the website operates but only if this was made clear to you and your express permission was granted when submitting any form to email process. Or whereby you the consumer have previously purchased from or enquired about purchasing from the company a product or service that the email newsletter relates to. This is by no means an entire list of your user rights in regard to receiving email marketing material. Your details are not passed on to any third parties.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Section 1" tab_id="1470424670384-93679d58-1e2f"][vc_column_text]Email Newsletter This website operates an email newsletter program, used to inform subscribers about products and services supplied by this website. Users can subscribe through an online automated process should they wish to do so but do so at their own discretion. Some subscriptions may be manually processed through prior written agreement with the user. Subscriptions are taken in compliance with UK Spam Laws detailed in the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003. All personal details relating to subscriptions are held securely and in accordance with the Data Protection Act 1998. No personal details are passed on to third parties nor shared with companies / people outside of the company that operates this website. Under the Data Protection Act 1998 you may request a copy of personal information held about you by this website's email newsletter program. A small fee will be payable. If you would like a copy of the information held on you please write to the business address at the bottom of this policy. Email marketing campaigns published by this website or its owners may contain tracking facilities within the actual email. Subscriber activity is tracked and stored in a database for future analysis and evaluation. Such tracked activity may include; the opening of emails, forwarding of emails, the clicking of links within the email content, times, dates and frequency of activity [this is by no far a comprehensive list]. This information is used to refine future email campaigns and supply the user with more relevant content based around their activity. In compliance with UK Spam Laws and the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003 subscribers are given the opportunity to un-subscribe at any time through an automated system. This process is detailed at the footer of each email campaign. If an automated un-subscription system is unavailable clear instructions on how to un-subscribe will by detailed instead.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="External Links" tab_id="1470424670015-a2e06ddd-0749"][vc_column_text]Although this website only looks to include quality, safe and relevant external links, users are advised adopt a policy of caution before clicking any external web links mentioned throughout this website. (External links are clickable text / banner / image links to other websites, similar to; Folded Book Art or Used Model Trains For Sale.) The owners of this website cannot guarantee or verify the contents of any externally linked website despite their best efforts. Users should therefore note they click on external links at their own risk and this website and its owners cannot be held liable for any damages or implications caused by visiting any external links mentioned.  [/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Section 1" tab_id="1470424669584-de0450f7-c052"][vc_column_text]Adverts and Sponsored Links This website may contain sponsored links and adverts. These will typically be served through our advertising partners, to whom may have detailed privacy policies relating directly to the adverts they serve. Clicking on any such adverts will send you to the advertisers website through a referral program which may use cookies and will track the number of referrals sent from this website. This may include the use of cookies which may in turn be saved on your computers hard drive. Users should therefore note they click on sponsored external links at their own risk and this website and its owners cannot be held liable for any damages or implications caused by visiting any external links mentioned.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Section 1" tab_id="1470424669155-c57531e1-46d0"][vc_column_text]Social Media Platforms Communication, engagement and actions taken through external social media platforms that this website and its owners participate on are custom to the terms and conditions as well as the privacy policies held with each social media platform respectively. Users are advised to use social media platforms wisely and communicate / engage upon them with due care and caution in regard to their own privacy and personal details. This website nor its owners will ever ask for personal or sensitive information through social media platforms and encourage users wishing to discuss sensitive details to contact them through primary communication channels such as by telephone or email. This website may use social sharing buttons which help share web content directly from web pages to the social media platform in question. Users are advised before using such social sharing buttons that they do so at their own discretion and note that the social media platform may track and save your request to share a web page respectively through your social media platform account.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Shortened Links in Social Media " tab_id="1470424667604-c58334ce-3cb6"][vc_column_text]This website and its owners through their social media platform accounts may share web links to relevant web pages. By default some social media platforms shorten lengthy urls [web addresses] (this is an example: http://bit.ly/zyVUBo). Users are advised to take caution and good judgement before clicking any shortened urls published on social media platforms by this website and its owners. Despite the best efforts to ensure only genuine urls are published many social media platforms are prone to spam and hacking and therefore this website and its owners cannot be held liable for any damages or implications caused by visiting any shortened links. [/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Before we make any recommendations or undertake any work we always complete a thorough fact-find process, this initial stage of any enquiry is usually without charge and will allow us to clearly The area we cover without charge is highlighted below, where you live outside this area we can still help, however a surcharge of £50 + £1 per mile will normally be applied. *Subject to availability and in conjunction with any services costing £100 or more. Note an hourly rate of £135 per hour is charged for general advice visits (where no services are being undertaken) with a minimum charge of 1 item.title: Free Will Writing
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" parallax="content-moving" parallax_image="12003" parallax_speed_bg="1.3" css=".vc_custom_1473108993310{background-position: center;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" el_class="main-hero"][vc_column el_class="tm-row-bgtype-dark vertalign" css=".vc_custom_1473108847617{padding-top: 60px !important;}"][tm-heading h2="Free Will Writing Service" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll hero-heading"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner el_class="left-hero" width="7/12"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="rgba(229,228,228,0.2)"][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll hero-text" css=".vc_custom_1473117092434{padding-top: 15px !important;padding-bottom: 15px !important;}"]Dunham McCarthy provides a face-to-face, professional, Will Writing Service. If you live in the midlands and are under the age of 65 the service is available entirely free of charge. This is simply a way for us to attract new clients, there is no catch, we just hope that should you or your family require other legal or financial services in the future you would consider using our firm.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner el_class="right-hero" width="5/12"][vc_raw_html el_class="hero-form darkplace"][/vc_raw_html][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll hero-text"]

Complete the form or call 01785 711556 to book your appointment today.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" bgtype="grey" css=".vc_custom_1473113958385{padding-top: 50px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text="``Someone's sitting in the shade today, because someone planted a tree a long time ago``" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center|color:%23838383" google_fonts="font_family:Lora%3Aregular%2Citalic%2C700%2C700italic|font_style:400%20italic%3A400%3Aitalic"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="will-steps" css=".vc_custom_1473109758144{padding-top: 60px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_raw_html el_class="attention-box"][/vc_raw_html][tm-heading h2="No Cost, No Catch, No Excuse!" txt_align="center" h4="Our Service" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll " css=".vc_custom_1473113919862{padding-top: 20px !important;}"][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]

If you are under 65 our professional will writing service is entirely free of costs; this includes taking your instructions, visiting you at home to check draft documents and to sign your final will. For us this is a fantastic way to meet new clients, there is no catch, we just hope that should you or your family require any legal or financial services in the future you would consider coming back to Dunham McCarthy. Our advisors can visit you across the greater midlands area, we also work evenings to make the service as convenient as possible - there really is no reason to put off making your will.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="will-steps" css=".vc_custom_1473112878706{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_tta_tour][vc_tta_section title="Single Wills" tab_id="1473109813034-9a0a62f5-61e7"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]A very common form of will, this type of document can be made individuals who want to ensure their assets are left to the right people in the simplest way possible. People in relationships may also make separate single wills if their wishes differ from those of their partners (where a couples wishes are similar two 'mirrored' wills would be more appropriate.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="11933" img_size="full"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Mirror Wills" tab_id="1473109813446-230d7bac-0ed1"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]A joint will is a will made by two or more “testators” (the persons who make the will, typically husband and wife). Although a single document, the wishes of each testator may be similar or different. When the first of the testators die the joint will is admitted to probate as if it is the will of the testator who has died. When the second testator dies the will is admitted to probate as if it is the will of that testator, and so on. This type of will is relatively unusual as, other than its simplicity, it has few benefits over single or mirrored wills. A joint will differs from a mutual will in that is not intended to be irrevocable or to express a mutual intention; it is merely an administrative convenience.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="11933" img_size="full"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Joint Wills" tab_id="1473111496419-d46491e9-539b"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]A joint will is a will made by two or more “testators” (the persons who make the will, typically husband and wife). Although a single document, the wishes of each testator may be similar or different. When the first of the testators die the joint will is admitted to probate as if it is the will of the testator who has died. When the second testator dies the will is admitted to probate as if it is the will of that testator, and so on. This type of will is relatively unusual as, other than its simplicity, it has few benefits over single or mirrored wills. When the second testator dies the will is admitted to probate as if it is the will of that testator, and so on. This type of will is relatively unusual as, other than its simplicity, it has few benefits over single or mirrored wills. !important;padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1472468553186{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][tm-heading h2="Why do I need a Will?" h4="Protect your family" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Research suggests that more than two-thirds of people in the UK don’t have a Will. Many people believe they are either too young to write a Will or that it’s too expensive or they don’t have enough money or property to make writing a Will worthwhile. The reality is that dying without a Will can make what is already a difficult time a lot harder for your family. You risk depriving your spouse or partner of their home, increasing any potential inheritance tax liability and leaving your estate in the wrong hands. With a younger family if the worst happens, in addition to having to deal with the loss of a parent or parents children are also faced with other problems. For example they may have to move house or change school; they may even be taken into care whilst social services appoint a suitable guardian. If you haven’t yet made your Will now is the time to act; especially if you have children. Do not leave it until tomorrow, life is uncertain and ‘tomorrow’ won’t come for an unfortunate few of us.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22Protect%20children%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2289%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22skincolor%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22Protect%20assets%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2257%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22skincolor%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22Provide%20for%20un-married%20partners%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2254%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22skincolor%22%7D%5D" shape="square" color="white" gap="10" active_section="50" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_tta_section title="Why is the service free?" tab_id="1473005204131-40083ef0-993c"][vc_column_text]At Dunham McCarthy we practice a holistic approach to estate planning with specialists providing advice on many legal and financial products and services. Our business has grown to provide for the varied needs of our clients. This growth, we feel, can be attributed to our relentless pursuit of the highest standards of customer service and professional expertise. The future of Dunham McCarthy will centre around developing our services to cater for the ever more complex needs of 10,000+ our existing clients.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Do I have to take any other services?" tab_id="1456301258052-77a8806b-99b3"][vc_column_text]Originally established to provide private clients with affordable and convenient professional services, Dunham McCarthy has grown from a small two partner firm, to a group of companies employing many professionals specialising in various financial and legal practice areas. The introduction of a 'Free Will Writing Service' designed to encourage clients to get organised has enabled Dunham McCarthy to grow quickly. With over 10,000 clients, it is this innovative approach coupled with exceptional long term customer service that sets us aside from our competitors.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="How do I register for the service?" tab_id="1456308251137-de6623ac-beae"][vc_column_text]At Dunham McCarthy we endeavour to foster an enjoyable working environment, based on open communication and mutual respect; we celebrate innovation, teamwork, and loyalty. For our clients we provide innovative solutions, and a dedication to quality customer service.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="How long does it take?" tab_id="1456308495551-78a791b2-7612"][vc_column_text]Our mission declares our purpose as a practice and serves as the standard against which we weigh our actions and decisions. Simply put it is to reach business goals through uncompromising dedication to client service and ethical standards - to put our clients at the center of our world.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="What area do you cover?" tab_id="1472468924815-6c15f860-63e3"][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" equalheight="true" css=".vc_custom_1472861409619{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}" break_in_responsive_996="true"][vc_column width="1/2" bgcolor="grey" css=".vc_custom_1473111776128{padding-top: 80px !important;padding-right: 60px !important;padding-bottom: 60px !important;padding-left: 60px !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_tta_accordion shape="square" color="white" gap="10" active_section="50" el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "][vc_tta_section title="Is it legally binding?" tab_id="1473005218838-175b6e41-c981"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Do I need a will?" tab_id="1473005219158-020efff2-da67"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="What other services do you offer?" tab_id="1473005280124-14e123bc-bba9"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="What type of Will do I need?" tab_id="1473005283118-4c19b503-df8c"][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="What information will I need?" tab_id="1473005287263-c44b5d87-6acb"][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1473006601772{background-image: url(http://final.dunham-mccarthy.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/mother-daughter.jpg?id=11884) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" el_class="overlaybgskin vertalign"][vc_column_text el_class="quote"]

item.title: Lasting Powers of Attorney - Myths and Facts
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
Two in three people will lose the capacity to make decisions at some point. The most common conditions that affect capacity include stroke; Alzheimer’s and other forms of dementia, someone could also lose mental capacity as the result of an injury, in a car accident for example.

In any situation where you lack capacity unless you have already completed a Lasting Power of Attorney, your loved ones will need to apply to become your 'deputy' through the Court of Protection, Deputyship is a time consuming and arduous court process that can cost thousands of pounds. To avoid this a lasting power of attorney is a legal document that lets you ‘the Donor’ appoint someone you trust known as an ‘attorney’ to make decisions on your behalf. In order to make a power of attorney you must still have mental capacity, once you have lost capacity, it is too late.

There are 2 types of power of attorney, one for Health Decisions and one for Financial Decisions. A Health Decisions power of attorney will allow you to appoint family or friends to make decisions about things like your daily routine (e.g. eating and what to wear); medical care; moving into a care home and life-sustaining treatment. A Financial Decisions power of attorney allows those appointed to make decisions about things like paying bills; managing Savings / Investments; collecting benefits and selling your home.

Joint Appointments

Myth: Appointing my spouse and children jointly as my attorneys is the best way for them to act.

Fact: Appointing family members jointly means that they must all act together for any given decision, for example all would need to sign to move a sum of money from one account to another. You would have to appoint your attorneys to act jointly and severally to enable them to act as individuals.

Sole Spouse Attorney

Myth: I only need my spouse to act for me.

Fact: If your spouse becomes unable to act then your Lasting Power of Attorney is useless. Also your spouse would not be able to deal with any property or accounts to which they also are a party, as this would be a conflict of interest. We always advise clients appoint more than one attorney and replacements and that they can act jointly and severally.

Age of Incapacity

Myth: Mental Incapacity is something that only effects people later in life, with illnesses such as Alzheimer’s, so because I’m young it is not important to me.

Fact: An accident or illness can strike at any time, often without warning. Your Lasting Power of Attorney needs to be signed as soon as possible, whilst you have your capacity, it’s that simple.

Spouse has Power

Myth: If I suffer an accident or illness, my spouse as my next of kin will automatically be able to deal with my affairs.

Fact: Your spouse or children do not have an automatic right to act on your behalf. Without a Lasting Power of Attorney, they will be required to apply to the Court of Protection to be appointed as your deputy.

Joint Accounts

Myth: I can simply add my spouse or children to my bank accounts, as joint account holders they will be able to carry on with my affairs as normal even if I lose capacity.

Fact: Banks are guided by the British Bankers Association to freeze both solely and jointly held accounts where one account holder loses mental capacity.

Next of Kin at Hospital

Myth: If anything happens to me my next of kin will be able to make decisions for me regarding any life sustaining treatment. Any doctor would have to follow their wishes.

Fact: Only by having an existing Lasting Power of Attorney can you give your next of kin the right to make choices about your health and welfare, including any life sustaining treatment you may need.

Cost of Deputyship

Myth: Can’t be that expensive, I’m next of kin anyway.

Fact: There are a number of costs associated with Court of Protection applications, these can run into many thousands over the years.

item.title: Can your Will be challenged?
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
Under the Inheritance (Provision for Family and Dependants) Act 1975, a will can be challenged if the deceased failed to provide reasonable financial provision for a spouse, cohabitee, dependant or child. Where a claim is upheld, the beneficiaries named in the will receive less than they were originally bequeathed.
A well-drafted will and a ‘statement of reasons’ can often help to avoid claims under the act or help to defend such a claim in court. A statement of reasons should be carefully drafted by the practitioner, and signed by the testator.
Litigation of this sort is becoming more prevalent partly due to ‘no win no fee’ agreements and peoples increasing financial needs. Where a claim is brought even if ultimately no award is made the administration of an estate can be delayed by up to three years. It is therefore essential where any potential claimants are being exclude by Will that a statement be prepared to help prevent any future litigation.

item.title: Shakespeare's Will back in Stratford
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: This summer William Shakespeare’s Last will and Testament, will go on display in Stratford-upon-Avon for the first time since Dr. John Hall, Shakespeare’s son-in-law took the will to London in June 1616 to get a grant of probate. By the 19th century, the will, leaving money for his actor friends to buy mourning rings to remember him by, and the notorious bequest to “my wife my second best bed with the furniture”, was so famous that tourists paid the hefty fee of a shilling to see it at Somerset House, then the home of the records of births, marriages and deaths. It has now returned, with other precious documents relating to Shakespeare’s life and work, from the present home of the National Archives at Kew. When the display is over it must go into storage in the dark for 20 years to preserve it for the future.

item.title: Prince didn't make a Will claims sister
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
It is understood that music superstar Prince did not make a will before his death last Thursday.
His sister said in court documents on Tuesday listing his six siblings or half-siblings as heirs to a legacy estimated at hundreds of millions of dollars.

item.title: 40% boost in care home fees
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Following a government-commissioned review nursing homes have received a 40% boost in the fees they receive for work carried out by registered NHS nurses. The government has increased the standard NHS-funded nursing care (FNC) rate from £112 to £156.25 a week, as recommended by audit firm Mazars, based on its assessment of the “reasonable cost” of funding the service.

item.title: Glasgow solicitor struck off
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
William Meechan, a1 solicitor responsible for a litany of failures has been found guilty of professional misconduct as a result of numerous failures, including dealing with executry [estate] proceeds in such a way as to conceal a client's financial position when she was claiming state benefits, and failing to issue a fee note to an executry before deducting his fees from the estate account.
The Tribunal could not accept that a would address the serious nature of this conduct as significantly as the honesty and trustworthiness of the Respondent demonstrated that the Respondent was not a fit person to be a solicitor. The Tribunal unanimously concluded that the appropriate disposal was to strike the name of the Respondent from the Roll of Solicitors in Scotland.

item.title: LTT will replace SDLT in Wales
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
From April 2018, Land Transaction Tax (LTT) will replace UK Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) in Wales. To provide stability and reassurance to businesses and the property market initially LTT it will be consistent with the current UK tax, retaining its key elements concerning partnerships, trusts and companies, and reliefs and exemptions.
The Office for Budget Responsibility forecast that Stamp Duty receipts would rise from only £145m in 2013-14 to £231m by 2018-19 — the year when control of the tax will be devolved. Although at £170,000 the average house price in Wales is lower than UK average of £267,000, according to the latest Office of National Statistics figures there has been no proposal to lower the threshold at which tax becomes payable. This lower limit currently stands at £125,000.
Decisions on tax rates will be made closer to April 2018, including an additional rate on second homes.

item.title: Welcome
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Ever expanding, our private client team welcomes Estate Planning Specialists Mark Hurst and Brett Ferguson.

item.title: Congratulations Ursula!
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
Ursula Minshall one of Dunham McCarthy's Senior Estate Planners has completed the first part of her STEP Diploma for the Administration of Estates. After much hard work and determination we are proud to share her achievement of passing the exam (with flying colours). STEP is designed to help advisers maintain and develop their skills and knowledge and helps to ensure our experts are fully competent when advising you with regards to your estate planning needs. Particular areas that the STEP qualification covers are:
  • Providing for an individual following their partner’s death, while protecting the interests of their children
  • Ensuring elderly or vulnerable relatives are cared for and supported
  • Helping families with interests spread across the world to be compliant with the laws and tax rules of different countries
  • Ensuring that a family business will pass safely from one generation to another
  • Helping clients to support charitable causes in an effective way

item.title: Leicestershire Partnership Trust
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
Employer Scheme
We would like to announce that Leicestershire Partnership NHS Trust are now offering our Free Will Writing service as part of their employer benefit. This adds to our current ten NHS Trust partnerships we already provide the service to. We are honoured that they entrust us to look after their employees.<!--more-->
Not only do we offer our free service to NHS staff we also provide this benefit to many other organisations including the West Midlands Fire Service, Birmingham City Council, Birmingham City College, Manchester Metropolitan University, HM Prison Service, Walsall Council, Waterloo Housing Group, City of Stoke on Trent Council.
If you feel that your company could benefit from our Free Will Writing Service please contact us at enquiries@dunham-mccarthy.co.uk.

item.title: Welcome
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Donna Byrne joins our business development team, focusing on increasing local business. Expect to see her at your local school, fete or office soon.

item.title: Safe Hands
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
We are pleased to announce that we have now formed a partnership with Safe Hands Funeral Plans. It is with great delight that they join our extensive panel of funeral plan providers. Safe Hands offer the fastest growing funeral plan and are the only pre-paid funeral plan company officially endorsed by the National Federation of Funeral Directors.
With funeral costs rising far in excess of the annual rate of inflation, a pre-paid funeral plan allows you to fix the cost of a future funeral at today's prices. Safe Hands guarantee that when you pass away, not only will your family be provided with all the support and reassurance they could possibly want, but all funeral director's fees and services will be covered in full.

item.title: NEC Baby Show
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: This weekend from Friday 13th May through until Sunday 15th May Dunham McCarthy will have 2 stands promoting our Free Will Writing Service at The Baby Show 2016 at the NEC. If you are thinking about using the service why not come and see us. Tickets are available from The Baby Show website

item.title: NEC Baby Show
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded:
Dunham McCarthy's appearance at the NEC for The Baby Show 2016 was once again a huge success. With over 400 new client's booked in for our Free Will Writing Service it's not too late to book for yourself.
Contact our offices on 01785 711 556 or via email enquiries@dunham-mccarthy.co.uk to take advantage of this wonderful opportunity.

item.title: Powers of Attorney
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]No one knows exactly what the future holds, thinking about what would happen if our faculties desert us is uncomfortable, but it's important to consider. If someone loses their capacity that means they can't make decisions anymore and will need help managing their finances. A Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) is a legal document where someone (while they still have mental capacity) appoints a trusted friend or relative to look after their affairs if they lose capacity. There are two types of LPA: one for financial decisions and another for health decisions. Your attorney should only make decisions for you if you're unable to make that specific decision at the time it needs to be made. For example, if you fall into a coma, your representative would start looking after your affairs. Yet if you wake from the coma, you should be able to make your own decisions again. What will happen if you have a stroke, serious accident or dementia for example? Who will deal with your affairs?[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472059315088{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading text="WE ARE DIFFERENT" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:15|text_align:left" google_fonts="font_family:Lato%3A100%2C100italic%2C300%2C300italic%2Cregular%2Citalic%2C700%2C700italic%2C900%2C900italic|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" el_class="animated fadeIn duration2 i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" el_class="tm-connected animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Our advisors are available between 8:30am and 9:00pm Monday to Thursday, and we can come to you at home or work.[/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="Face to Face Advice" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-power-off" i_on_border="" i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" el_class="tm-connected animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Where possible we will always sit down and discuss things with clients face to face, no forms to complete, just expert advice.[/tm-servicebox][tm-servicebox h2="Qualified Advisors" txt_align="left" add_icon="left" i_icon_fontawesome="fa fa-modx" i_on_border="" i_background_color="skincolor" i_size="md" item.excerpt:encoded: A lasting power of attorney (LPA) is a way of giving someone you trust the legal authority to make decisions on your behalf if you lack mental capacity at some time in the future or no longer wish to make decisions for yourself.

item.title: Will Writing
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Research suggests that more than two-thirds of people in the UK don’t have a Will. Many people believe they are either too young to write a Will or that it’s too expensive or they don’t have enough money or property to make writing a Will worthwhile. The reality is that dying without a Will can make what is already a difficult time a lot harder for your family. You risk depriving your spouse or partner of their home, increasing any potential inheritance tax liability and leaving your estate in the wrong hands. With a younger family if the worst happens, in addition to having to deal with the loss of a parent or parents children are also faced with other problems. For example they may have to move house or change school; they may even be taken into care whilst social services appoint a suitable guardian. If you haven’t yet made your Will now is the time to act; especially if you have children. Do not leave it until tomorrow, life is uncertain and ‘tomorrow’ won’t come for an unfortunate few of us.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Research suggests that more than two-thirds of people in the UK don’t have a Will. Many people believe they are either too young to write a Will or that it’s too expensive or they don’t have enough money or property to make writing a Will worthwhile. The reality is that dying without a Will can make what is already a difficult time a lot harder for your family. You risk depriving your spouse or partner of their home, increasing any potential inheritance tax liability and leaving your estate in the wrong hands. With a younger family if the worst happens, in addition to having to deal with the loss of a parent or parents children are also faced with other problems. For example they may have to move house or change school; they may even be taken into care whilst social services appoint a suitable guardian. If you haven’t yet made your Will now is the time to act; especially if you have children. Do not leave it until tomorrow, life is uncertain and ‘tomorrow’ won’t come for an unfortunate few of us.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner item.title: Inheritance Tax Planning
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]In law, conveyancing is the transfer of legal title of property from one person to another. The most common reasons you would engage a conveyancer is when you are buying or selling a property; subdividing land; updating a title (i.e. registering a death) or registering, changing or removing an easement. The whole process is complex and time-consuming and therefore usually undertaken by either a conveyancer or a solicitor. In relation to a house purchase or sale a typical conveyancing transaction consists of two stages, first is the exchange of contracts (where the title of the property passes from one owner to the next); and completion where the transfer completes and the property is now in the hands of the purchaser. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472059315088{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading item.excerpt:encoded: Care home fees, divorce, bankruptcy, disability, claims against the estate, the list goes on, find out how we can help ensure your property remains in your family and is not lost to a third party.

item.title: Funeral Planning
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Although something we prefer not to think about, planning your funeral in advance is a thoughtful way of sparing your family the emotional and financial burden of dealing with your funeral arrangements after you have passed away. Funeral costs are going up every year, the average cost of a funeral in 2004 was £1,920 today, its £3,693, an increase of 92%, which is significantly above inflation. At this rate, in ten years the average cost of a funeral could be more than £6,700. A funeral plan protects you and your family from the rising cost of funerals and gives emotional peace of mind that the funeral will be the celebration of your life that you want it to be. It also allows you to dictate what type of service you would like, so that when the time comes, not only will your family be relieved of a considerable financial burden, but they'll also be spared the distress of having to make difficult and uncomfortable decisions. Losing a loved-one is an incredibly stressful and emotional time, with considerations such as funeral expenses often causing further concern, a funeral plan will make things easier for your loved ones. We provide advice on a number of different funeral plans from different providers, to help you find the best plan based on your circumstances and priorities.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472059315088{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading text="WE ARE DIFFERENT" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:15|text_align:left" item.title: Estate Administration
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Estate administration is the process of dealing with a individuals legal and tax affairs after they’ve died. This means dealing with their assets (such as home, savings accounts and personal possessions), paying debts and paying any taxes (Usually Income Tax and Inheritance Tax). Whatever's left is transferred to beneficiaries according to the laws of intestacy or their will if they made one. Normally when an individual draws up a will, it will include one or more named executors. When the individual dies, the executor(s) of the will become responsible for estate administration. If the executors are unwilling or unable to act, if the will does not name any executors, or if there is no will at all, then an administrator takes responsibility for the estate. The whole process can be extremely complex and is required after every death, whether or not there is a Will.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472059315088{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading text="WE ARE DIFFERENT" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:15|text_align:left" item.excerpt:encoded: Following the death of a relative or friend it is often necessary to obtain a grant of probate or letters of administration (if there is no will), find out how we can help you through this process.

item.title: Document Storage
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]Your Will ensures your estate is distributed according to your wishes, it is a precious legal document that must be kept safe. Our service gives clients the confidence to relax in the knowledge that one of the most important documents they are ever likely to sign is in safe hands. Documents kept at home are easily lost or misplaced, especially if you move house. Moreover, there is a considerable risk of accidental loss, burglary, destruction by fire, flood or tampering over the many years it is likely to be stored for, the result is that your efforts will have been in vain and that your estate will be subject to the rules of intestacy. So once completed, signed and witnessed to overcome this problem we provide a state of the art document storage facility. We also provide our clients with Membership Cards, enabling them to notify their family where the Will is kept so your executors can get fast access to your Will when it is required - we are then on hand to help guide them through the legal maze of Probate.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1472059315088{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_custom_heading text="BENEFITS" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:15|text_align:left" item.excerpt:encoded: Receiving an inheritance can create problems for a disabled person. Take advice on Disabled Persons Trusts which make provision for those suffering from a mental or severe physical disability.

item.title: Conveyancing
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text el_class=" animated fadeIn duration2 eds-on-scroll "]In law, conveyancing is the transfer of legal title of property from one person to another. The most common reasons you would engage a conveyancer is when you are buying or selling a property; subdividing land; updating a title (i.e. registering a death) or registering, changing or removing an easement. The whole process is complex and time-consuming and therefore usually undertaken by either a conveyancer or a solicitor. In relation to a house purchase or sale a typical conveyancing transaction consists of two stages, first is the exchange of contracts (where the title of the property passes from one owner to the next); and completion where the transfer completes and the property is now in the hands of the purchaser. item.excerpt:encoded: Conveyancing is the legal process you go through when buying or selling a property, remortgaging or extending a lease. Whatever your plans our associates are able to help.

item.title: Mr Moxon
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I found this to be a really positive experience. They were flexible with appointments, even coming out to see me at the weekends! The adviser was very approachable and gave good advice, and I was actually able to get a better financial offer on my insurance as well as getting my Will sorted so I was really pleased, I’d definitely recommend the service!

item.title: Mr Hughes
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: The adviser was pleasant and polite; she couldn’t do enough for us! Basically, she came at a convenient time, did what I asked and I was happy! There’s nothing to fault, a truly professional Will Writing Service

item.title: Mr Fairhurst
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: We were very happy; the service was flexible and organised around us. The adviser was really nice and friendly, and took the time to explain everything we asked thoroughly. If you need to make a Will I would recommend them

item.title: Mrs Bailey
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I thought the service was great, really flexible. Initially I was really daunted by the whole thing but the advisers were nice and everything was explained fully to me. In the end I recommended the service to my friends!

item.title: Mr Hicks
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: The service was very good, in fact my wife took out an insurance policy as well! The adviser covered all the bases and there was no beating around the bush, that’s what I liked about it! It’s a big step to write a Will, I’ve been putting it off for years, but the adviser really made it a lot easier!

item.title: Mrs Keach
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I really thought the service was excellent, I would recommend it to anyone! The adviser was brilliant, and he came out to our home, it couldn’t be more convenient! To be honest, I couldn’t fault it.

item.title: Mrs Drakeley
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I thought the service was excellent, anything free is good! I was given good advice, and the adviser was brilliant; very informative and they kept in touch until everything went through. I’ve recommended this to my friends

item.title: Mrs Stanley-Carvahlo
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: The service was really good, very thorough and professional. The adviser listened to what we wanted and was able to select a product they thought would be best suited to our needs. I was very pleased with the service overall.

item.title: Mr Khan
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Dunham McCarthy’s advisor was brilliant. We were advised in a clear and professional way. All appointments were arranged to suit me and the timing was excellent. The communication throughout was superb and there was no pressure at any time. The whole service has been a great benefit. Nothing was too much trouble with everyone I dealt with

item.title: Ms Hamilton
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: A truly fantastic service. The advisor that came out was lovely, very approachable & put me totally at ease and we can now rest assured everything is sorted - total peace of mind.

item.title: URSULA MINSHALL
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.excerpt:encoded:
Ursula joined Dunham McCarthy in 2012. She has recently completed STEP Advanced Certificate in Administration of Estates and is a member of STEP. She takes pride in her ability to resolve a variety of estate planning issues with compassion during what can sometimes be an emotional and complex time for clients.
Ursula enjoys socialising with her friends, attending yoga classes and spending time with her husband and two children.

item.title: MARK CHILTON
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.excerpt:encoded: Mark Chilton joined Dunham McCarthy in late 2014. He is an Estate Planner and works within the legal department. Mark studied at Staffordshire University and has a Degree in Law and a Post Graduate Diploma in Legal Practice. His interests outside work include a passion for music. He plays the electric and acoustic guitar.

item.title: Mrs Stevens
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I thought the service was really convenient, I was very impressed. I found the adviser polite, professional and helpful, and I found the process thorough, which gave me time to consider everything properly so I didn’t feel rushed.

item.title: Mr Bailey
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: When our Will was done the advisor walked us through the whole service brilliantly. We liked the fact that the Will was then brought out to our home to check through, it was also great how everything was explained in detail. What was even better is that advice was given but not pressured into doing anything we didn’t want to.

item.title: Miss Lopez
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I found the service very friendly and I am delighted to have received a Free Will that would have ordinarily cost me £119.00. Communication was prompt. When they went through the Will they made sure they went through everything thoroughly and clearly. Overall, I can't sing there praises enough I am very happy & pleased.

item.title: Mrs Lee
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: They explained everything without using jargon and gave us appointment times to suit us, not them. They also provided lots of options to ensure should the worst happen our family is well taken care of. It was a very quick turnaround from our enquiry to having a signed Will. The thing that stuck out most was the advisor who was so so friendly.

item.title: Mrs Cage
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Everything was great about the service and the advisor was very nice. they came out to see us twice and were on time and explained everything so well in great detail. They also saved us a lot of money on our life policies and made sure it was structured in a way that gave us peace of mind should the worst happen - we would highly recommend them.

item.excerpt:encoded: Having a succession plan in place will help the smooth transition of your business on death from yourself to your family at the same time as minimising inheritance tax.

item.excerpt:encoded: Protecting your home and other assets through simple planning can ensure that your children and grandchildren will benefit from your lifetimes work.

item.title: Mr Biffen
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: All our questions were answered with full and simple explanations. The advisor who visited our home made us feel relaxed, although a serious subject we actually enjoyed our meetings. He was able to find life cover for us when we thought it wouldn’t be available. We were so impressed and will recommend Dunham McCarthy to everyone we know.

item.title: Mrs Bhirth
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: This was a very, very good service. Superb communication at all times keeping us informed throughout the process. We were very pleased with the gentleman who came to our house and he gave superb advice for the benefit of our family. I have been recommending this service to everyone I know.

item.title: Mr Tsang
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: I decided to take advantage of the free Will offer. It was so easy and took hardly any time at all. Most of it was completed after work meaning I didn’t have to take any time off work or go anywhere else. We found it to be so helpful that everything could happen when it was convenient for us. We would definitely recommend.

item.title: Mrs Edwards
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: This is an excellent service. The advisor was very knowledgeable and professional and the information provided was priceless. A real pleasure to deal with, so much so I have recommended several friends.

item.title: Mrs Forde
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Prompt, friendly service. We had looked at various will writing companies, when a friend our ours recommended Dunham McCarthy. They delivered exactly what was expected but they worked around our work and went through things in detail. Why we had been putting off writing our Wills for so long I do not know.

item.title: Mr & Mrs Speed
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: We were very pleased with the whole process. The service was convenient and professional, everything was discussed in simple terms, we have recommended Dunham McCarthy to all our family and friends for will writing.

item.title: Ms Harris
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: The will writing process was so convenient; the staff were professional, knowledgeable and personable. They put me at ease throughout the whole process. I now feel reassured and would happily recommend their services to others.

item.title: Mr & Mrs Matty
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: Dunham McCarthy were fantastic they were polite and informative when they took our instructions. When they booked appointments they were very accommodating. The advice was clear, concise, accessible and professional – I have recommended their services to friends and family.

item.title: Mr Nugent
item.dc:creator: AlexC
item.content:encoded: The service was excellent, in fact the whole process was very thought provoking – Dunham McCarthy guided us through everything clearly. Nothing was too much trouble, all of the appointments were worked around us. We were really pleased, so much so we have recommended to 6 other family members.
